to thoroughly prepare the garments,
with regular patterns of embroidery,
regulations for size,
standards for length,
and measured quantities of clothing,
necessarily following the old rules,
with regular caps and belts.

to strictly enforce all punishments,
and executions must be appropriate.

one will receive calamity in return.

order the stewards and priests
to inspect the sacrificial animals:
to see that they are complete;
to examine their fodder;
to observe their fatness;
to inspect their color;
they must be classified;
Measure the large and small,
Observe the long and short,
All meet the standard.

To ward off auxiliary diseases,
So as to facilitate the passage of autumn Qi.
Use dogs to taste hemp seeds,
First, sacrifice at the ancestral temple.
In this month,
One can build city walls,
Establish capitals,
Dig caves and cellars,
Repair granaries and storehouses.
Then order the officials
To urge the people to gather in the harvest,
Strive to store vegetables,
And accumulate many provisions.
Then encourage the planting of wheat,
Without missing the season;
If anyone misses the season, punish them without hesitation.
In this month,
Day and night are equal.
The thunder then begins to cease its sound.
Hibernating insects all bow down in their holes, all sealing their doors.
The killing aura is increasingly strong,
the yang energy wanes daily.
The water begins to dry up.
(When) day and night are of equal length,
then standardize measures,
level scales,
correct balances,
and align volumes.
In this month,
ease tariffs at the borders and markets,
attract merchants and travelers,
bring in goods and valuables,
in order to facilitate the people's affairs.
People from all directions come together,
distant regions all arrive,
then wealth and goods will not be lacking,
the government will have no shortage of resources,
and all affairs will be accomplished.
In all undertakings, do not go against the heavenly order,
you must follow the season,
and act according to their kind.
If you execute this command,
the white dew will fall in thirty days.
If in mid-autumn you execute the spring command,
then the autumn rain will not fall,
grasses and trees will flourish,
The state would then have great fear.
If the summer season's orders are carried out,
then the state will have drought,
hibernating insects will not hide away,
and the five grains will sprout again (out of season).
If the winter season's orders are carried out,
then wind disasters will arise frequently,
thunder will occur before it is due,
and plants and trees will die early.
8.2 *On Authority*
Secondly, it is said:
Righteousness is
the guideline for all matters,
the source from which the relationship between ruler and minister, superiors and inferiors, intimacy and distance arises,
and the place where order, chaos, safety, danger, excess, and victory reside.
Overcome excess;
do not seek it from others;
it must be reflected upon oneself.
Human nature desires life and hates death,
desires glory and hates disgrace.
If the principle of life and death, glory and disgrace, is unified,
then the soldiers of the three armies can be made to be of one mind.
In general, an army desires a large number of soldiers,
and the mind desires unity.
If the three armies are of one mind, then orders can be made invincible.
If one can ensure invincibility,
then one's army will also be invincible throughout the world.
The ultimate form of warfare in ancient times
placed great importance on commands from the people.
They valued the world,
and revered the emperor.
These commands were stored in the hearts of the people,
and were as swift as the movement of their own skin.
The people held them with deep pain and unwavering resolve,
and could not be swayed or shaken.
Nothing could move them.
If this were the case, what enemy would be worth defeating?
Therefore, it is said that if one's commands are strong, then one's enemy is weak;
and if one's commands are trustworthy, then one's enemy will yield.
If victory is first achieved here,
then victory will surely be achieved there.
Generally speaking, weapons
are the most ominous tools in the world;
and courage
is the most ominous virtue in the world.
To wield ominous tools
and practice ominous virtues
is only permissible as a last resort.
Wielding ominous tools must lead to killing;
killing
is done to preserve life.
Practicing ominous virtues must lead to awe;
Majesty
is what is used to intimidate.
When the enemy is intimidated, the people prosper;
this is why righteous armies flourish.
Therefore, the ultimate armies of ancient times,
before the talent of the people was combined,
majesty had already been communicated,
and the enemy had already submitted.
Why necessarily use drumsticks, shields, and spears?
Therefore, one who is good at communicating majesty
does so before it is manifested,
before it is made known.
Dark and obscure,
none know the true situation;
this is called the sincerity of ultimate majesty.
In general, warfare requires urgency, speed, and preemptiveness.
The way to achieve urgency, speed, and preemptiveness
lies in understanding the distinction between slowness, deliberation, and tardiness on the one hand, and urgency, speed, and preemptiveness on the other.
Urgency, speed, and preemptiveness
are the means by which righteous armies secure victory.
And it is imperative not to linger too long.
Knowing that one cannot remain for long,
one then knows where to act with the swiftness of a rabbit and the suddenness of a duck taking flight, and where to meet life and death.
Even if there are dangerous rivers, cross them;
even if there are great mountains blocking the way, break through them.
Combine one's spirit and concentrate one's essence,
the mind without worry,
the eyes without seeing,
If the ears hear nothing,
then all actions become martial and forceful.
When Ran Shu swore to die for Lord Tian,
the whole state of Qi was afraid.
When Yu Rang swore to die for Xiangzi,
the whole Zhao clan was terrified.
When Cheng Jing devoted himself to death for the Lord of Han,
all the people of Zhou were in awe.
How much more so if a state of ten thousand chariots
has something it is truly committed to?
What enemy could there be?
Before blades are even crossed, victory is already within reach.
The enemy's grief, fear, apprehension, and terror
utterly deplete their spirit and essence.
They are all like frenzied souls,
their form and nature separated.
